title: Participatory Project-Based Training to Improve Novice Teachers' Perceptions of Learning Support

context.prior_knowledge: Science Curriculum Instruction Experience and Basic Understanding of Teaching Profession Practices
context.additional_context: Educational course focusing on analyzing learning support systems experienced by novice science teachers in diverse school environments and deriving improvement strategies. Explores interactions between personal networks and formal/informal support systems from a participatory learning perspective

learning_goals: Novice teachers can apply a framework to evaluate the scalability/limitations of learning support systems in their educational contexts

Within six months, learners can develop a practical plan to collaborate with three peer teachers and two local science museums/research institutes, secure five or more types of science education resources (experiment kits, digital content, etc.), and write an implementation report.

Through participatory observation (analysis of twice-weekly class recordings) and reflective practice (weekly reflective journaling), learners can identify three major challenges in their teaching adaptation process, propose two or more actionable improvement strategies, and receive an execution feasibility rating of 4/5 or higher from a supervising teacher.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
